channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: オーストラリアのメディア当局、スポーツ中継中のギャンブル広告禁止違反でセブン・ネットワークに1万3000豪ドルの罰金、SBSは視聴者にギャンブル広告のブロックを許可（Amanda Meade/The Guardian）
item.description:
Amanda Meade / The Guardian:
Australia's media authority fines The Seven Network AU$13K over breaching a ban on gambling ads during live sports; SBS now lets viewers block gambling ads  —  Media regulator cracks down while federal government considers recommendation to ban online gambling ads within three years

item.title: BBC、CNN、CBSのジャーナリストを使った同様のフェイクに続き、VOAロシア語サービスのアンカー、クセニア・トゥルコヴァの肖像を使ったディープフェイク動画が暗号ソフトウェアの売り込みに使われた（Liam Scott/Voice of America）。
item.description:
Liam Scott / Voice of America:
A deepfake video used the likeness of VOA Russian Service anchor Ksenia Turkova to pitch crypto software, after similar fakes of BBC, CNN, and CBS journalists  —  Like so many others, the video looks real at first glance.  —  Ksenia Turkova, a journalist with VOA's Russian Service, is seated at a desk looking directly at the camera.

item.title: パラマウントは、チャンネル5のVODプラットフォームMy5とプルートTVを統合し、2024年に英国で無料の広告付きオンラインTVサービスを再開する予定（Daniel Thomas/Financial Times紙）
item.description:
Daniel Thomas / Financial Times:
Paramount plans to relaunch its free, ad-supported online TV services in the UK in 2024 after merging the Channel 5's VOD platform My5 with Pluto TV  —  US media giant will combine Channel 5 platform with Pluto TV  —  Paramount will merge and relaunch its free online services in the UK next year …

item.title: 米国著作権局に提出された書類の中で、MPAはAIに関する新たな著作権法や特別な規則は「必要ない」とし、「融通の利かない」ガイドラインに警告を発している（Ted Johnson/Deadline）
item.description:
Ted Johnson / Deadline:
In a US Copyright Office filing, the MPA says there is “no need” for new copyright legislation or special rules for AI and warns against “inflexible” guidelines  —  - MPA Sees “No Need” For New AI Copyright Legislation Or Special Rules, Warns Of “Inflexible” Guidelines

item.title: アップルは一部のインド人ジャーナリストに対し、国家が支援したiPhoneサイバー攻撃の標的にされたと語ったが、「特定の国家が支援した攻撃者」とは断定しなかった（Gerry Shih/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Gerry Shih / Washington Post:
Apple told some Indian journalists that they had been targeted in state-backed iPhone cyberattacks, without attributing “any specific state-sponsored attacker”  —  NEW DELHI — Apple has warned at least 20 prominent Indians, including opposition politicians and journalists …

item.title: 情報源投資家ナサニエル・ブルックス・ホーウィッツと作家サム・コッペルマンが設立したハンターブルックは、ニュース部門が発掘した記事を取引する1億ドルのファンドを計画中（フィナンシャル・タイムズ）。
item.description:
Financial Times:
Sources: Hunterbrook, founded by investor Nathaniel Brooks Horwitz and writer Sam Koppelman, plans a $100M fund to trade on stories unearthed by its news arm  —  Fund would get exclusive access to market-moving stories before they are published  —  A group of veteran US financial journalists …

item.title: ヒット曲のカタログを買い取るレコードレーベル、Reservoir Mediaのゴルナー・コスロシャヒCEOに、著作権、ジェネレーティブAIの影響などについてQ&A（Nilay Patel/The Verge）
item.description:
Nilay Patel / The Verge:
Q&A with Golnar Khosrowshahi, the CEO of Reservoir Media, a record label that buys catalogs of hit songs, on copyright, generative AI's impact, and more  —  The publisher behind the songwriting copyrights to some of the most popular music ever recorded doesn't think AI spells doom for the industry.

item.title: YouTube、広告ブロッカーのユーザーに広告を許可するかYouTube Premiumを試すよう促す「世界的な取り組みを開始」（Emma Roth/The Verge）。
item.description:
Emma Roth / The Verge:
YouTube “launched a global effort” to encourage users with ad blockers to allow ads or try YouTube Premium, after a “small experiment” earlier in 2023  —  YouTube is broadening its efforts to crack down on ad blockers.  The platform has “launched a global effort” …

item.title: SmartNewsのコンテンツ担当副社長リッチ・ジャロスロフスキーは、年末に常勤職を退く予定だ。
item.description:
Chris Roush / Talking Biz News:
SmartNews VP of Content Rich Jaroslovsky plans to step down from a full-time job at year's end; Wendy Bounds is taking over and Bernie Davis' role will expand  —  Rich Jaroslovsky, vice president of content and chief journalist at SmartNews, sent out the following to his colleagues on Tuesday:

item.title: TikTok、YouTube、Instagramなどでニュースを報道・集約するクリエイターたちを見てみよう。
item.description:
Taylor Lorenz / Washington Post:
A look at some of the creators who report and aggregate news on TikTok, YouTube, Instagram, and more, as people under 35 move away from traditional news outlets  —  One recent study concluded consumers are looking for news that “feels more relevant,” giving a boost to creators on social media

item.title: 情報筋フォーブスのオーナーはルミナーCEOオースティン・ラッセルに8億ドルの入札を最終決定するよう2週間以上与える、ロシア人幹部マゴメド・ムサエフ氏は投資を否定（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Sources: Forbes' owners give Luminar CEO Austin Russell two more weeks to finalize his $800M bid; Russian executive Magomed Musaev denies investing in the deal  —  Austin Russell, the 28-year-old Luminar Technologies CEO who is seeking to buy Forbes, has requested an extension of a Nov. 1 deadline …

item.title: フォーブスのジャーナリストによると、ロシア人実業家マゴメド・ムサエフがフォーブスの新たなオーナーになったと報じられたことで、機密情報の提供を拒否する情報筋もいるという（Max Tani/Semafor）
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Forbes journalists say some sources are refusing to give them sensitive information due to Forbes' new reported ownership by Russian businessman Magomed Musaev  —  The Scoop  —  Forbes journalists have told the publication's management that some sources are refusing to share sensitive information …

item.title: マイクロソフト・スタートが女性の死に関する記事の隣にAIが作成した世論調査を配置したことで、ガーディアンは評判を傷つけられたとしている（Dan Milmo/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Dan Milmo / The Guardian:
The Guardian says its reputation was damaged after Microsoft Start placed an AI-generated poll about a woman's death next to the outlet's article about her  —  Publisher says poll speculating on cause of woman's death that appeared next to Guardian article caused ‘significant reputational damage’

item.title: Artforumの編集者3人がEICの解雇で辞職、アーティストやアートライターはペンスキー傘下のArtforum、ARTnews、Art in Americaに記事を書かないと誓約（Artnet News）
item.description:
Artnet News:
Three Artforum editors quit after the EIC was fired; artists and art writers have pledged not to write for Penske-owned Artforum, ARTnews, and Art in America  —  Artists and writers have signed a petition to boycott the publication alongside others owned by Penske Media.

item.title: ニュース・メディア・アライアンス調査：開発者はLLMを訓練するために、一般的なウェブコンテンツよりも記事に依存している。
item.description:
Katie Robertson / New York Times:
News Media Alliance study: developers rely on articles more than generic web content to train LLMs; the NMA says this shows that AI companies violate copyright  —  The News Media Alliance, a trade group that represents newspapers, says that A.I. chatbots use news articles significantly more than generic content online.
